TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . He is represented before the ORG by PERSON . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) are represented by Mr PERSON , Representative of GPE at ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
At the material time the applicant was the head councillor of the Dmitrovskiy administrative district in GPE .

On DATE the GPE Mayor , by decision no . CARDINAL , fixed the election to the GPE City Duma for DATE . ORG is the permanent representative and legislative body of the city of GPE that has CARDINAL members elected for a term of DATE .
On DATE district electoral commission no . CARDINAL registered the applicant as a candidate in the election .

On DATE a private person PERSON lodged a complaint with a court , asking it to cancel the registration of PERSON because he had allegedly omitted to report a part of his income on his property declaration and because he had used his official position for electoral campaigning .

At TIME on DATE ORG delivered judgment . The court found that the applicant ’s property declaration had only listed his taxable earnings without mentioning his tax - exempt revenue , that he had organised a meeting with the local residents at the expense of the council budget , and that he had used his acquaintance with a Government minister in order to create the impression that his bid for elections had been supported by the federal executive power . By law , these grounds were sufficient to cancel the registration of the applicant as a candidate in the election . Pursuant to LAW , the judgment was final and enforceable with immediate effect .

At TIME on DATE which was the voting day , the district electoral commission no . CARDINAL ordered Mr PERSON ’s name to be struck out of the list of candidates . Whilst his name on the information stand had been crossed out without delay , the manual correction of the voting ballot papers was only completed TIME .
The applicant did not take part in the election , in which CARDINAL of his competitors participated .

On DATE ORG of GPE , in the proceedings initiated by CARDINAL private complainants , determined that that LAW was incompatible with a constitutional right to the effective judicial protection in so far as it provided for finality and immediate effect of judgments concerning violations of electoral rights , without affording the aggrieved party a possibility to lodge an appeal against them ( Ruling no . CARDINAL-P ) .

On DATE the applicant , relying on ORG decision , lodged a notice of appeal against the judgment of DATE . He challenged the factual findings and alleged a number of procedural defects . He claimed , in particular , that he had not been duly notified of the complaint lodged by PERSON , that a copy of the complaint had not been communicated to him and that the court had delivered its judgment at CARDINAL.CARDINAL p.m. , that is in TIME time ” , according to the definitions in LAW and LAW .
On DATE ORG of GPE upheld on appeal the judgment of DATE , endorsing the reasons exposed by ORG .
The LAW of the Russian Federation guarantees to the citizens of GPE the right to elect and to stand for election to ORG and municipal bodies ( LAW ) .

LAW ( Federal Law on LAW and of their Right to Participate in a Referendum , no . CARDINAL of DATE ) provided that registration of a candidate could be cancelled at the latest on DATE the voting day ( section CARDINAL § CARDINAL ) . A similar provision was contained in section QUANTITY of LAW on LAW of ORG , Mayor , Vice - Mayor and ORG , no . CARDINAL of DATE .

After the candidate had been registered , if the information he had submitted about himself , including his financial statement , was found to have been substantially untrue , his registration could be cancelled by the electoral commission ( DATE before the voting day ) or by a court of general jurisdiction ( from DATE before the voting day ) ( section CARDINAL § CARDINAL ) .
A procedural step may be performed until TIME on DATE of the time period within which it must be performed ( LAW ) .

Judgments concerning complaints about the actions or failures to act of ORG or municipal authorities , electoral commissions and their officials which violated ORG electoral rights , come into force immediately after their delivery , with exception of judgments concerning contestation of the election results ( LAW ) . An appeal may only be lodged against the judgments that have not come into force ( LAW .

On DATE ORG issued a ruling on compatibility of certain provisions of LAW with LAW ( no . CARDINAL-P ) . It determined , in particular , that whereas cancellation of a candidate ’s registration was permitted until and including DATE the voting day , a judicial decision ordering cancellation should have become final by DATE . ORG confirmed this position in its decision no . CARDINAL-O of DATE .
